snippet: “Headstrong,” a tepid play by Patrick Link, looks at football injuries and the price players pay for their sport.
abstract: Jason Zinoman reviews Patrick Link play Headstrong, directed by William Carden at the Ensemble Studio Theater; Ron Canada and Alexander Gemignani star. (M)
lead_paragraph: Could concussions hurt football as badly as steroids did baseball? It's doubtful, but in the last few years, as focus has increased on how injuries effect the long-term health of football players, it's no longer inconceivable. Alan Schwarz in The New York Times rigorously chronicled the devastating toll of concussions, including increased risk of depression and suicide. Lawsuits have been filed. Congress held hearings. And some people have questioned whether it's ethical even to watch games. The death of Junior Seau may bring even more scrutiny to this issue.

headline.main: A Wonderfully Exciting Game That Just Happens to Kill Its Own Stars
